result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremey Charles Pufahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/cover letter from Agent S. Olmsted
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Jeremey Charles Pufahl in court with attorney Hannah E Huettl. Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called. State is in receipt of the revocation summary. No corrections noted. State and defense reviews credit. State heard as to recommendation. State recommends 90 days concurrent to current sentence.  Adjustment to supervision noted as "better".  Defense is in agreement with recommendation. Court is heard and addresses Pufahl. Court finds that concurrent sentence is appropriate, finds Pufahl guilty on Count 2- 90 days concurrent to 15CF277 sentence- with HUBER privileges. Court orders 68 days jail credit. Unpaid court obligations converted to civil judgment. Appeal rights to be reviewed.

Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 28, 2018 at 11:40 am.
Mailed to LISO jail

records.addlTxt: Statement as to negotiated plea

Defendant Jeremey Charles Pufahl in court, in custody with attorney James Richard Lex.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM19, 16CM135 called - No victim rights issues
Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court - Arguments by State/Defense/Defendant/Court to sentencing 
16CM135 - Plea no contest - 5 days jail with huber (credit is unknow) - CC/Surcharges - To be paid within 60 day from release of custody
16CM19 - Count 2 - Plea no contest - Count 1 DRI - Sentence withheld -12 months probation - Costs/Surcharges (Domestice abuse S/C) $125.00 SPF - Counseling as recommended by Agent - No contact with MP unless agent and victim agree - AODA and follow through with treatment recommendations -  No alcohol - No taverns - Court will not order any additional jail on this case
Expungement in 16CM19 upon successful completion of probation and payment of all court obligations
Post conviction rights given
